result.execSummary:
The defendant Lakoda Grey Beebout was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Last 90 days may be served on electronic monitor if Defendant qualifies, and this is only if probation is revoked. - stayed.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs/DNA Surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
May be expunged if successfully completed.

No direct or indirect contact with co defendant Brendan Castaneda.
No direct or indirect contact with Menards and Walmart stores unless they indicate to the Agent that the allow Defendant to come on to premises. Agent needs to agree with the contact as well.
Write letters of apology to the stores.
Comply with counseling and assessments as recommended by the agent.
Court will allow early discharge from probation after 6 months.

timeConds.notes: Perform 50 hours of community service preferrably with Portage County Parks Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lakoda Grey Beebout

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation
from DOC - Probation Early Discharge Recommendation

Defendant Lakoda Grey Beebout in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:14 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

State has filed an amended information.

Defendant will plead to Counts 1 and 2 and 3.
Atty Cousins states the agreement.

Atty Drengler concurs.
Defendant concurs.

State has filed a copy of the restitution summary.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Misdemeanor Retail Theft
Count 2: Misdemeanor Retail Theft
Count 3: Misdemeanor Retail Theft

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Victim notification requirements have been complied with.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. Defendant brought a money order today to pay for the restitution.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted
Last 90 days may be served on electronic monitor if Defendant qualifies, and this is only if probation is revoked
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay restitution of $347.84 to Menards today
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Perform 50 hours of community service preferrably with Portage County Parks Department
No direct or indirect contact with co defendant Brendan Castaneda
No direct or indirect contact with Menards and Walmart stores unless they indicate to the agent that the allow Defendant to come on to premises. Agent needs to agree with the contact as well.
Write letters of apology to the stores
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Comply with counseling and assessments as recommended by the agent
May be expunged if successfully completed
Court will allow early discharge from probation after 6 months

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed, Concurrent to Count 1
Huber granted
Last 90 days may be served on electronic monitor if Defendant qualifies, and this is only if probation is revoked
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
May be expunged if successfully completed
Court will allow early discharge from probation after 6 months

Count 3:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed, Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Huber granted
Last 90 days may be served on electronic monitor if Defendant qualifies, and this is only if probation is revoked
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
May be expunged if successfully completed
Court will allow early discharge from probation after 6 months

3:24 p.m. Defendant Lakoda Grey Beebout in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with Walmart and Menards in Plover, WI and Brenden Casteneda.

Defendant Lakoda Grey Beebout in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Knaapen recommends a $5,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
